title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Feb. 11)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: Recent home sales in Abington featured a one-family raised ranch at 144 Helen Drive for $735,000.
In Acton, a Cape Cod style home at 4 Huron Road sold for $875,000 on a 22,900-square-foot lot.
A one-family Colonial in Arlington, located at 56 Valentine Road, sold for $2,100,000.

title: Hundreds of students displaced after burst pipe closes UMass Boston dorm
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A burst sprinkler pipe displaced hundreds of UMass Boston students from East Residence Hall due to flooding Monday.
Approximately 50 rooms incurred water damage across floors 2-10, leading to a 'no occupancy' status for safety reasons.
UMass Boston provided temporary housing at UMass Amherst and essential items; East Residence dining hall reopens Wednesday.

title: Seattle Public Library schools the Boston Public Library with book recommendations for Patriots fans
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Seattle Public Library recommended over 35 Seattle-themed books to Boston Public Library after Seahawks beat Patriots in Super Bowl LX.
Recommendations include 'Inflation,' a guide by Mark Blyth and Nicolö Fraccaroli, and Michael Bennett's memoir, 'Things That Make White People Uncomfortable.'
Both libraries participate in Books Unbanned, advocating for teen reading rights without censorship nationwide.

title: State auditor sues Beacon Hill to force compliance with audit
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: State Auditor Diana DiZoglio sues Beacon Hill to enforce her authority to audit the Massachusetts Legislature.
Nearly 72% of voters approved the audit authority, but House leaders refuse compliance; Attorney General Campbell declines to represent DiZoglio.
House Speaker Mariano, Senate President Spilka, and other officials are named as defendants in the state Supreme Judicial Court lawsuit.

title: Man arrested in Seaport, charged with human trafficking
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Schineider Dave Macean, 23, was arrested in Seaport on charges of human trafficking and related offenses.
An undercover operation by Boston and State Police led to Macean's arrest near Seaport Boulevard and Thompson Place.
Macean will be arraigned in South Boston District Court following the sting operation in Seaport.

title: As Boston residents report daytime coyote sightings, here’s how to stay safe
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Coyote sightings have increased in Boston during their mating season from January to March, despite stable population levels.
MassWildlife advises keeping pets indoors and removing food sources to prevent conflicts with coyotes.
Hazing techniques, such as making loud noises and physical presence, are recommended to deter coyotes effectively.

title: Cam Newton reverses course with his comments on Drake Maye after Super Bowl loss
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Cam Newton praised Patriots QB Drake Maye after initially criticizing his performance in the 2025 season.
Maye's playoff struggles included two interceptions and a fumble in Super Bowl LX against the Seattle Seahawks.
Despite postseason issues, Drake Maye was the NFL MVP runner-up, falling just short of Rams QB Matthew Stafford.

title: James Hagens wins Beanpot MVP as Bruins prospects thrive in tournament
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: James Hagens won the 2026 Beanpot MVP, helping Boston College defeat Boston University 6-2 at TD Garden.
Hagens, a Boston Bruins prospect, scored two goals and five points over the Beanpot tournament, showcasing his offensive skills.
Boston College's team included Bruins prospects Andre Gasseau and Dean Letourneau, who also made significant contributions in the win.

title: Patriots CB Carlton Davis shares his pitch to free agents ahead of busy offseason
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots CB Carlton Davis emphasizes team's positive culture to attract free agents after Super Bowl LX loss to Seahawks.
Patriots have $42.7 million in cap space and potential for more by restructuring contracts for offseason acquisitions.
Patriots' recent success, including franchise QB Drake Maye, makes them an attractive destination for free agents.

title: Sticker shock for a dealer’s quote to replace a starter
author: John Paul
bullets: A dealership quoted $1,200 to replace a starter on a 2014 Honda Accord EX, seen as high by a customer.
The cost breakdown includes a starter list price of $643 and approximately 1.2 hours of labor at $165 per hour.
Labor rates vary, and dealership charges can be 30 to 36 percent higher than those of independent shops.
